venue.name: Au Bon Pain at Harvard Square

item.description: Revolving along a one-mile stretch on the banks of the Charles River, the 29th annual Cambridge River Festival on Saturday, June 14, 2008 celebrates the city?s cultural diversity through music, dance, and the arts. Captivating people of all ages and backgrounds, nationally recognized musicians and visual artists will entertain at this lively outdoor celebration. Free to the public and produced by the Cambridge Arts Council, this summertime event brings the Greater Boston community together to enjoy the talents of performers and artists.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be the bald asian guy in a T-shirt and jeans around the chess table area
item.why: You'll love it because it is free!

group.name: The Cambridge and Boston Singles Meetup
